title: Middle East Crisis: Colombo and Mattala airports on standby for emergency landings
byline: The Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) and the Mattala International Airport have been kept on standby for any requests by civil airlines for emergency landings, the Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka.

title: SriLankan Airlines diverts multiple flights amid airspace closures
byline: Five SriLankan Airlines flights have been diverted to the Muscat International Airport in Oman, the King Khalid International Airport in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia and the Dubai International Airport in the United Arab Emirates due to the current situation in the Middle East.

title: Several Middle East countries temporarily shut down airspaces
byline: Qatar, Bahrain, the United Arab Emirates and Kuwait have closed their respective airspaces following airstrikes by Iran targeting the Al Udeid US military base in Doha.

title: Donald Trump says Israel and Iran have agreed to ‘complete and total’ ceasefire
byline: Donald Trump has just announced a “total ceasefire” between Iran and Israel.

title: Israel and Iran agree on ceasefire to end 12-day war, Trump says
byline: Donald Trump has just announced a “total ceasefire” between Iran and Israel.

title: ‘No agreement on any ceasefire’: Iran refutes Trump’s claim
byline: Iran’s foreign minister Abbas Araghchi says there is no ceasefire agreement in place but they may continue to stop firing if Israel does.

title: Qatar and other countries reopen airspace after Iran’s attack on US base near Doha
byline: Qatar has reopened its airspace after closing it earlier on Monday in anticipation of retaliatory attacks by Iran on a US air base near Doha.

title: Middle East Crisis: BIA reports flight delays, no cancellations for now
byline: No flights have been cancelled at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), despite the decision by several countries in the Middle East to close their respective airspace following airstrikes by Iran on a military base in Qatar yesterday (23).

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: US crude oil futures fall over $3 as Trump announces Israel-Iran ceasefire
byline: U.S. crude futures fell on Tuesday to their lowest level in more than a week as U.S. President Donald Trump said a ceasefire has been agreed between Iran and Israel, relieving worries of supply disruption in the area.

title: Sri Lankans in Qatar advised to remain vigilant and closely monitor directives
byline: Sri Lankan citizens in Qatar have been advised to stay indoors, remain vigilant and closely follow the advice issued by the government of Qatar, the Sri Lankan Embassy in Qatar stated.

title: 8 dead, 2 survive after boat capsizes on Lake Tahoe
byline: Eight people were killed and two survived after a boat capsized on Lake Tahoe in California over the weekend due to a large swell, authorities said.

title: Missile sirens sound across central and southern Israel
byline: Sirens are sounding across northern Israel and some areas in the south following the launch of ballistic missiles from Iran, according to a report by the Times of Israel.

title: Sri Lankan leaves Iran using special evacuation flight operated by India
byline: A Sri Lankan national has left Iran and reached New Delhi last evening (23) on a special flight operated by the government of India.

title: 17 Sri Lankans to leave Israel on special flight operated by Indian govt.
byline: A total of 17 Sri Lankans in Israel have registered to travel on a special flight operated by the Indian government, amidst escalating violence in the Middle East, Sri Lankan Ambassador to Israel Nimal Bandara stated.

title: Magnitude 6.3 earthquake strikes east of Philippine islands, GFZ says
byline: An earthquake measuring 6.3 magnitude struck east of Philippine islands on Tuesday, the German Research Centre for Geosciences (GFZ) reported.

title: No info yet on Ishara Sewwandi’s whereabouts: Public Security Minister
byline: There is no information yet confirming that Ishara Sewwandi, the fugitive female suspect in connection with the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, alias “Ganemulla Sanjeewa”, Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala has stated.

title: Iran state TV confirms Donald Trump’s ceasefire
byline: Iranian state television reported early Tuesday that a ceasefire had begun in its conflict with Israel, displaying a bold on-screen graphic.

title: Opposition party heads Lapid, Golan call for end to fighting after announcement of Iran ceasefire
byline: Opposition Leader Yair Lapid and The Democrats chairman Yair Golan both call for an end to fighting in Gaza, following US President Donald Trump’s announcement of a ceasefire between Israel and Iran.

title: UN Human Rights High Commissioner meets PM Harini
byline: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk, who arrived in the island yesterday (23) on an official visit has held discussions with Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, at the Prime Minister’s Office.

title: Sri Lanka will maintain constructive dialogue with UN on human rights issues: FM
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Tourism and Foreign Employment, Vijitha Herath has reaffirmed the government of Sri Lanka’s commitment to maintaining a constructive and cooperative dialogue with the United Nations on human rights issues.

title: UK plans to increase control over Google in search
byline: Britain’s competition regulator on Tuesday said it was proposing to designate Google with “strategic market status” to give it greater control over how the U.S. tech giant operates search services.

title: Gold at near 2-week low after Trump announces Israel-Iran ceasefire
byline: Gold prices fell to a near two-week low on Tuesday as risk appetite improved after U.S. President Donald Trump said Iran and Israel had agreed to a ceasefire, denting demand for safe-haven assets.

title: ‘Ceasefire is now in effect, Please do not violate it!’ - Trump
byline: US President Donald Trump has said “the ceasefire is now in effect” in a post on Truth Social.

title: 2025 Human Development Report presented to Speaker
byline: The Human Development Report for the year 2025, published under the United Nations Development Programme has been formally presented to Speaker of House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: Four killed in missile strike in southern Israel, Israel’s emergency services says
byline: Israel’s emergency services has said that four people have been killed after a missile struck a residential building in the southern Israel city of Beer Sheva.

title: We will not fail the people of Sri Lanka despite Israel-Iran conflict – Cabinet Minister
byline: Unlike previous administrations, the present government will not fail the people of Sri Lanka despite the ongoing conflict between Israel and Iran, the Minister of Plantation and Community Infrastructure, Samantha Viddyarathna stated.

title: Specialist neurosurgeon at J’pura Hospital and two others further remanded
byline: Dr. Maheshi Wijeratne, a specialist neurosurgeon attached to the Sri Jayewardenepura General Hospital, and two others who were arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), have been further remanded, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: PM Harini leaves for Canada
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has left for Canada early this morning (24).

title: Colombo Central Bus Stand to be upgraded under “Clean Sri Lanka” initiative
byline: The government has devised plans to upgrade the Colombo Central Bus Stand within the next year, in line with the “Clean Sri Lanka” programme, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Benjamin Netanyahu confirms Israel has agreed to ceasefire with Iran
byline: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has confirmed his government has agreed to a ceasefire with Iran.

title: Visitor damages Uffizi painting while posing for photo
byline: A visitor has damaged a 17th-century painting at the Uffizi Galleries in Florence after stumbling back into it while posing for a photo, the museum told CNN in a statement.

title: European citizen detained in Iran on espionage charges
byline: The Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps in Iran has detained a European national on allegations of espionage, according to reports from Iranian state media.

title: World leaders gather for historic NATO summit with unity on the line
byline: World leaders were gathering in the Netherlands on Tuesday for the start of a historic two-day NATO summit that could unite the world’s biggest security organization around a new defense spending pledge or widen divisions among the 32 allies.

title: Israeli defence minister orders attacks on Iran after ceasefire ‘violation’
byline: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz has just issued a statement, saying he has ordered the Israel Defense Forces to “respond forcefully to Iran’s violation of the ceasefire with intense strikes against regime targets in the heart of Tehran”.

title: SJB secures power in Gampola UC and Bentota PS, chaos in Bandaragama
byline: The establishment of power in several local government institutions where no party had a clear majority following the 2025 Local Government election took place today (24).

title: Thailand blocks tourists from entering Cambodia as their border tensions soar
byline: Thailand began imposing land border restrictions Monday including blocking tourists heading into Cambodia as the two countries engage in retaliation in their border dispute.

title: New chairpersons for four state institutions including DLB approved
byline: The Committee on High Posts has recently approved the appointment of Chairpersons of four state institutions, including the Chairman of the Development Lotteries Board (DLB).

title: NPP secures power in 200 local government bodies
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has succeeded in securing power in 200 local government bodies across the country.

title: Iran-Israel ceasefire: IDF claims truce breached as missiles launched from Iran
byline: Israel is reporting a fresh round of missiles has been fired from Iran.

title: Iran denies firing missile at Israel
byline: Iranian state media has responded to Israel’s accusations, saying Iran denies reports that it fired a missile at Israel after the ceasefire began.

title: Over 200 foreigners rescued from scam centres still stranded along Thai-Myanmar border
byline: More than 200 foreign nationals rescued from scam centres in eastern Myanmar remain stranded along the war-torn country’s border with Thailand, according to a local rebel group overseeing their repatriation.

title: Facebook scam misusing Dehiwala Zoo’s name; CID requested to investigate
byline: The Dehiwala Zoological Gardens in Sri Lanka has submitted a formal letter to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) regarding a fake social media account misusing its name and allegedly engaged in fraudulent activities.

title: CID investigating ex-President Ranil’s overseas trips
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) informed the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court today (24) that it has launched an investigation into the overseas trips made by former President Ranil Wickremesinghe during his tenure as president.

title: Iran President says will respect ceasefire if Israel does
byline: Iran’s President Masoud Pezeshkian said Tuesday that it will respect a ceasefire announced by US President Donald Trump provided that Israel also upholds its terms.

title: President’s Secretary stresses need for broad policy to tackle banking sector challenges
byline: A meeting between Secretary to the President Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake and the Bank of Ceylon (BoC) Employee’s Union was held this morning (24) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Fresh explosions in Iran; Israel says air force destroyed radar installation near Tehran
byline: Israel-Iran War: Sounds of fresh explosions were heard coming from the northern part of Iran, with Israel confirming that it had struck a radar installation near Tehran.

title: Shooting incident reported in Borella
byline: A shooting incident has been reported at Wanathamulla in Borella, a short while ago.

title: Special traffic plan in Colombo for Bohra Conference
byline: The Global Bohra Conference and Spiritual Convention, which will be held under the patronage of the spiritual leader of the Dawoodi Bohra community, is scheduled to take place tomorrow (25) at the Sri Lanka Exhibition and Convention Centre (SLECC) on D. R. Wijewardena Mawatha in Colombo Fort.

title: Trump says both sides violate ceasefire, tells Israel: ‘Do not drop those bombs’
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump accused both Israel and Iran of violating a ceasefire on Tuesday hours after he announced it, expressing particular frustration with Israel which had announced plans for major new strikes on Tehran.

title: ‘Praja Shakthi’ national programme to launch under President’s patronage
byline: The ‘Praja Shakthi’ National Programme, initiated by the current government with the aim of empowering communities and ensuring the equitable distribution of economic benefits, is scheduled to be launched on July 4 at the Temple Trees under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.
